settings.heading: Here’s the thing about wine...
settings.text:
Since its inception millennia ago, it’s been one of life’s simple pleasures. And we believe that simple pleasure should be accessible (and easy to enjoy) for everyone.

That’s right: no jargon, no fuss – just honest flavours and genuine value.

Our approach reflects just that.

We farm sustainably on 410 hectares of cool-climate vineyards, harvest with care, and let nature take the lead in the cellar. The result? Wines full of character, balance, and real South African soul – at a price that makes sense.

From weekday dinners to weekend celebrations, Alvi’s Drift gives you wine that overdelivers in every glass.

No pretence. Just quality. Every time.

settings.heading: People
settings.text: Behind every bottle are the hands that made it. We support our farm community with fair wages, safe housing, healthcare, and opportunities for growth – because people are our foundation.

settings.heading: Planet
settings.text: Our land gives us everything – so we farm it with care. From water-wise practices to low-intervention winemaking, sustainability guides every step in the vineyard and cellar.

settings.heading: Future
settings.text: Through our partnership with the Indaba Institute, we invest in what’s next: early childhood education, nutrition programs, and youth development that empowers the next generation to thrive.

settings.title: Signature Selection
settings.description: Our 221 Range pays homage to the legacy of our founder, Oupa Alvi, who had a legendary rugby career as the 221st player for South Africa’s national team, the Springboks. Bold and contemporary, it blends tradition with modern winemaking, offering vibrant, fruit-forward wines with a stylish edge.

settings.question: What does the Breede River’s terroir contribute to Alvi’s Drift wines?
settings.answer: The Breede River’s terroir lies at the core of our wines’ character. The river, which cuts through our farm in the Scherpenheuwel wine ward, and the surrounding mountains, create a unique microclimate of hot days and cool, nocturnal Atlantic breezes. This diurnal temperature variation ensures grapes ripen fully, developing intense fruit-forward flavours, while simultaneously retaining fresh, natural acidity. This signature balance of richness and freshness is our terroir’s greatest contribution.
